description: Listed building application for refurbishment of modern interior at ground, first and second floor levels with new layout of bar serveries, WCs, Cloaks area and raised seating/booths. Minor refurbishment of historic auditorium area bar servery to first floor. New raised seating areas with booth/banquette seating. Opening to be created through a structural wall with new steps between modern and historic buildings at first floor level. New free-standing partition walls with raised viewing galleries and handrails (to match existing) to historic auditorium second floor.

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to the commencement of the relevant works, specifications and detailed drawings of the proposed recladding of the bar servery to the historic auditorium second floor must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved specification/drawings. Reason: In order to safeguard the significance of the listing building, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

All work involving the removal of existing historic fabric associated with the development hereby approved must be carried out with hand tools only. If this cannot be achieved, the method of removal shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement. The works shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development to safeguard any heritage assets present on the site.

All new works and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile. Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with paragraphs 212 to 221 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2024, policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012.
